revised_title: Discovery of Dioecious Character in Rotifera
tldr: The author, Philip Henry Gosse, discusses the discovery of separate sexes in Rotifera, specifically in the genera Asplanchna and Notommata. This challenges the previously held belief that all Rotifera were hermaphrodites. The author provides detailed observations and descriptions of the reproductive processes and differences between male and female specimens, contributing to a better understanding of the sexual reproduction in this class of animals.
